prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. For this part, the Euler Angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector should be set to [0.0, 0.0038, 0.0]. Next, create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create a new face (face\\_1). On face\\_1, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) as follows: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5625] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.5625] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Each loop must be closed, as demonstrated above. This particular loop consists of 4 lines. Now, scale the 2D sketch in all directions by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by using the rotation information from the coordinate system and the translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model. For the extrusion, use an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0038 units and an extrusion depth opposite normal of 0 units. The sketch scale should be set to 0.75. The operation for this part is a "New Body Feature Operation." The final dimensions of this part are as follows: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.0037 units * Height: 0.75 units The next part will be created based on this part, using the defined operation (New Body Feature Operation).</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0038,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.5625]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.5625],"End Point":[0.0,0.5625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0038,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A long, thin, vertical cylinder with a slightly tapered top Start by creating a new coordinate system for this part. Use the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0043, 0.0] Once you have the new coordinate system ready, proceed by sketching a rectangle. The rectangle will have four lines as described below: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0043] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0043], End Point [0.0, 0.0043] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0043], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The rectangle forms a closed face in the sketch. There is only one face and one loop for this sketch. The loop is defined by the four lines mentioned above. The sketch is complete at this stage. Next, manually set the scale for the sketch considering the `sketch_scale` provided: 0.75. Now, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] (from coordinate system) * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0043, 0.0] (from coordinate system) After 3D sketch transformation, extrude the sketch. Perform the extrusion operation with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0043 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 (same as defined earlier) * Operation: NewBodyFeatureOperation (create a new solid body for this part) After completing the part's instructions, the resulting shape will be a long, thin, vertical cylinder with a slightly tapered top. Refer to the JSON provided for more information on `description`, such as height, width, and length. Intermediate part dimensions: * Height: 0.75 * Width: 0.0043 * Length: 0.75</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0043,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0043]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0043],"End Point":[0.0,0.0043]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0043],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0043,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating a 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole in the Center** **Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch** Using the new coordinate system, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch should consist of: - One face (face\\_1) On face\\_1, create three loops (loop\\_1, loop\\_2, and loop\\_3) as follows: **Loop 1:** - line\\_1: Start Point [0.1442, 0.0], End Point [0.6058, 0.0] - arc\\_1: Start Point [0.6058, 0.0], Mid Point [0.75, 0.1442], End Point [0.6058, 0.2885] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.6058, 0.2885], End Point [0.1442, 0.2885] - arc\\_2: Start Point [0.1442, 0.2885], Mid Point [0.0, 0.1442], End Point [0.1442, 0.0] **Loop 2:** - circle\\_1: Center [0.1442, 0.1442], Radius 0.0721 **Loop 3:** - circle\\_1: Center [0.6058, 0.1442], Radius 0.0721 *Note: All dimensions and coordinates are given in the respective units used in the JSON.* **Step 3: Transforming the Sketch** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the following parameters: - Scaling: uniform scaling using a factor of 0.75 - Rotation: no rotation (Euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) - Translation vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 4: Extruding the Sketch to Create the 3D Model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.0961 units and in the opposite normal direction by 0.0 units. Apply the sketch\\_scale factor of 0.75. The resulting 3D model represents a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is slightly offset on the z-axis, as described in the JSON. *The final shape has dimensions of approximately: 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.096 units (length x width x height).*</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.1442,0.0],"End Point":[0.6058,0.0]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.6058,0.0],"Mid Point":[0.75,0.1442],"End Point":[0.6058,0.2885]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6058,0.2885],"End Point":[0.1442,0.2885]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.1442,0.2885],"Mid Point":[0.0,0.1442],"End Point":[0.1442,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1442,0.1442],"Radius":0.0721}},"loop_3":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.6058,0.1442],"Radius":0.0721}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0961,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Step 1: Create the coordinate system - Set the Euler angles to (0°, 0°, -90°) - Set the translation vector to (0, 0.1962, 0.0251) Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch - Create a new face (face\\_1) - Draw the first loop (loop\\_1) as follows: + line\\_1: Starting point (0, 0), End point (0.75, 0) + line\\_2: Starting point (0.75, 0), End point (0.75, 0.6026) + line\\_3: Starting point (0.75, 0.6026), End point (0, 0.6026) + line\\_4: Starting point (0, 0.6026), End point (0, 0) - Draw the second loop (loop\\_2) as follows: + line\\_1: Starting point (0.0761, 0.0753), End point (0.6739, 0.0753) + line\\_2: Starting point (0.6739, 0.0753), End point (0.6739, 0.5272) + line\\_3: Starting point (0.6739, 0.5272), End point (0.0761, 0.5272) + line\\_4: Starting point (0.0761, 0.5272), End point (0.0761, 0.0753) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch - Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch - Apply the transformation using the given euler angles and translation vector Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model - Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0981 units - Set the operation to 'creating a new solid body' Dimensions and properties - The length of the prism is 0.75 units - The width of the prism is 0.0981 units - The height of the prism is 0.75 units</description>
